Articles.Content:
Quick question- as in real quick

I'm going to Iceland in less than four hours- those who (might) look at my SESEOR mission log (see sig ( if not, please do) will unfortunately not get the content I wanted to put up for 3 days. If I have the twitch app, can I see kerbolkon on my Ipad?
Probably Rhyunix, but that depends on Twitch and the availability of Wifi in your area

Quick question- as in real quick

I'm going to Iceland in less than four hours- those who (might) look at my SESEOR mission log (see sig ( if not, please do) will unfortunately not get the content I wanted to put up for 3 days. If I have the twitch app, can I see kerbolkon on my Ipad?

All you need is twitch app open on the ksptv broadcast. Also you must have an active wifi connection.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ed_Lu

Didn't recognize the name at first. Awesome, thanks!

All you need is twitch app open on the ksptv broadcast. Also you must have an active wifi connection.
Probably Rhyunix, but that depends on Twitch and the availability of Wifi in your area

W000000T! I have wifi at hotel- what time is it?

W000000T! I have wifi at hotel- what time is it?

In Mexico it starts at 10 in the morning, so in Iceland, at GMT it should start at 4.
See schedule, but it starts at 10AM CST
Excellent.....

Other useful timezone start information:

CUT-11: 5:00AM

CUT-9 (Alaska): 7:00AM

CUT-8 (Pacific Time): 8:00AM

CUT-7 (Mountain Time): 9:00AM

CUT-5 (Atlantic Time): 11:00PM

CUT-4 (Georgetown, etc.): 12:00PM

CUT-2 (Mid-Atlantic Time): 2:00PM

CUT-1 (Cape Verde Island, etc.): 3:00PM

CUT (Greenwich Standard Time): 4:00PM

CUT+1 (West Europe Time): 5:00PM

CUT+2 (East Europe Time): 6:00PM

"One major element of KerbalKon has to do with update 0.23. WeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re going to be spilling all the details on the release that just so happens to be launching this Tuesday, December 17"

Straight from the Tumblr. Another release date. Can't say I'm happy with this change. I liked the "When its done" attitude. Ah well, not like a release date changes the content that is released.

I feel that the addition of a release date shows that Squad is maturing as a company and is beginning to understand what is needed to reach a given goal at a set time. This is good news if we are looking down the road to a "release-ready" game.

I think when most people complain about a lack of release dates, they're looking for announced release dates significantly more than a week in advance.

Anyway, super excited for tomorrow!
Keep up the good work SQUAD! -New Mexico
